The pool and pool bar is not owned by the hotel so you can only use it during the day - by late afternoon the lifts are blocked up to the pool. The pool bar is a great place for lunch. There are lots of loud private parties going on up there most evenings.e,g pool parties on Sunday afternoons so forget laying by the pool. Not much going on in the immediate outside area - but the hotel is well staffed with good security . So - not good for families - but just great for someone who enjoys drinking cocktails and people watching. The manager Chris was particularly helpful and really made a difference to our stay - the hotel is lucky to have him as he does actually make things happen. They really will accommodate any request if they can which is a great USP.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sales Kickoff meeting ever!”
Reviews.Author: adeemoore
Reviews.Content: Our colleagues traveled from all over the world and all were in agreement the W was the best venue ever for our Sales conference. The professional service, attention to detail, atmosphere, restaurant and bar, quality rooms and reasonable rates were superb. We can't wait to come back...maybe next time just for the fun of it.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Spunkyzgal
Reviews.Content: Great looking brand new hotel although we found the location gritty (not the best part of Hollywood Boulevard and although seasoned travellers we at times felt a little unsafe). Staff were a highlight â€“ above and beyond helpful and friendly! We got a complimentary room upgrade on check in too which was much appreciated. Room was very nice and Bliss bathroom products are amazing â€“mmmm lemon and sage soap-my favourite. We had a great view of Hollywood Boulevard from the day bed in our room. Hotel becomes a hot spot at night and is a maze of security and velvet ropes â€“ we had to get special passes to show security just to get back in but we had no problems with this as security were great. Just a word of caution- music blares into early morning from downstairs so if you are a light sleeper this might not be the place for you (we didnâ€™t mind this at all). Complimentary lemon water and cake available in lobby in the afternoon. Acura free car service also available although with the time/distance restrictions we didnâ€™t bother. Only thing that spoiled our stay were the insane phone charges. We had a phone card and were having trouble using it so ended up going out to an operator several times when trying to connect. We also later gave up and phoned home. The result- $2 per every time we tried to connect to phone card ($20 in total) plus $62 for a few minutes call to Australia. We nearly fell over when we got the bill. When we enquired at the front desk about why call rates were not posted near the phone she shrugged and said something about checking the inroom manual. We never found it though. Also wifi available for $16 per day in room or free in lobby (although the one time we did this we felt pressured to buy drinks from the lobby bar there so just ended up getting wifi in the room). Didnâ€™t use pool or restaurant but both seemed nice. We usually stay in Beverly Hills or Santa Monica but wanted to try something different. We probably wouldnâ€™t come back because my husband hated the location which is a shame because the hotel itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous but misleading”
Reviews.Author: JBH_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as we wanted to be in 'the thick' of Hollywood, which the W is. It's a very glamorous hotel with great reception staff and a beautiful lobby. The room was nice but frankly the descriptions used by W - 'Wonderful, Spectacular, Fabulous' are more confusing than aspirational. Just seemed like a standard hotel room to me. A week before arriving, I sent a request for a booking in Drai's lounge for drinks one evening before going out to dinner which was left unanswered and when we inquired at check in were told that we would have to contact Drai's directly as there was no relationship between them and the W. If this is the case, I don't understand why Drai's are listed on he W website as facilities of the hotel. The rooftop pool is lovely and I believe accessible during the day but not at all at night when the club is operating. Can you believe that you need special passes during these times just to get into the lobby and up to your room but as before, this doesn't give access to many of the facilities listed on the website. Valet is very expensive but there is a $10 carpark just across the road, which is not only much cheaper but would be quicker than waiting for your car to arrive during busy periods. We only had breakfast in Delphine once, which was OK but they had run out of English Muffins for the Eggs Benedict and the service was erratic. An explanation was given at the end of the meal that the waiter had just started but I don't see why that should have been our problem. This is undoubtedly a hip and happening hotel in an up and coming part of town but we felt that we had been misled and at the end of the day is was a disappointing rather than a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate for a Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the W. It's fun and upbeat. Service was great. I think I especially liked it because of the "We love teachers" rate. What a deal!!! You won't find it on-line; but, if you're a teacher, it's worth the phone call. There was a lot going on in "The Living Room" (lobby bar), and we spotted a celebrity checking in. We later saw that he was in Hollywood for "Dancing with the Stars". You'll love it if you can get a great rate like I did. Otherwise, it's a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood-”
Reviews.Author: sfbayvip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many W Hotels across the globe and I have to say after spending the weekend at the W Hollywood and enjoying the atmosphere, food, gym, pool, bars and restaurants it is now my favorite hotel in California. Upon check in ask for the W Insider: Chris Nelson to assist in your W Hotel experience. http://www.starwoodhotels.com/whotels/property/overview/index.html?propertyID=1789 When going to the W Hotel Hollywood ensure to book in advance and also make sure to go to Drai's Nightclub. http://draishollywood.com/flash/index.php

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by how GOOD it is!”
Reviews.Author: BGinOC
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I almost didn't book at the W, but I was attending a concert at the Pantages Theatre and you can't get any more convenient than the W. For those using mass transit, it's literally on top of the Hollywood and Vine station - take the Red Line from Union Station. ATTITUDE: yes, this is a new and very hip hotel. But every staff member I met was friendly and totally committed to service. From the valet parking to the front desk to room service to the Men in Black (security folks needed for the club scene), everyone was great. FOOD: I always sample room service my first time at any property. Food arrived earlier than promised and I was impressed. The onion soup gratinee was simply the best I've ever had. A simple prime beef cheeseburger was great: a hand formed patty in a light bun with the usual trimmings and condiments. And the French fries... I've never been impressed by fries before but now I am. ROOM: Trendy, well appointed and comfortable. The universal cell phone (or other gizmo) charger was handy. If you're worried about party noise from the clubs, spend a few extra bucks for an exterior-facing room. I did and had no trouble with noise. SUMMARY: Would I come here again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: mishottie
Reviews.Content: I don't even have the energy to provide a detailed account of our experience, but I can tell you that I have stayed at Starwood properties all over the United States and this was the worst experience I have had and I only stayed one night. The GM may turn the negative reviews around as I have heard good things about him through the grapevine. There were a couple of exceptional staff (CJ and Marc), but for the most part it was pretentious, insulting, discriminating, and overrated. Don't: Expect to get into the nightclub if you are not "someone" or know "someone" (Yes, Drai's is owned by another entity - Victor Drai). This will eventually wear off as all new L.A. Clubs do. Count on using the pool if they have a private event up there. Expect to be able to have a cocktail and/or sit out on the patio off the Living Room in the lobby (as there was a private party there, too). Expect courtesy Expect air conditioning or temperature control. "WISH" for anything reasonable because wishes really DO NOT COME TRUE HERE. Do: Save your money and stay somewhere you will be treated with class Stop in for a poorly made cocktail just to see the Living Room Wait and "WISH" the GM, Jim McPartlin, listens to all the negative feedback and does something to change it

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel. The W Hollywood gave our vacation the exact "Hollywood" factor we were hoping for.”
Reviews.Author: rknsf
Reviews.Content: We took our 17-year old nephew to LA on Spring Break to celebrate his straight A's. We wanted to find a hotel that would have all of the comforts and luxury that two of us in our 40's wanted....combined with the "wow" factor that would impress a 17-year old boy. The W Hollywood was our answer - and it was perfect. The most impressive thing about this new hotel is the staff. We were there for 7 days and 6 nights and every single person that we encountered was remarkably friendly (and equally beautiful). The valet area....the external decor....the lobby are all beautiful. The velvet ropes just add an element of Hollywood to the experience....and they are easily entered with the W Hollywood guest card. The rooms were spotless and comfortable. The decor was pleasing to the eye and there was a nice lounging area in the window that made for perfect napping and book reading while the rest of the family was at Six Flags. The restaurant was also great.....with delicious food and friendly service that made us feel like stars ourselves. I also thought it was a good value. We could have easily paid more for an older place with smaller rooms and far less glitz and glamour. Our stay here was perfect. The hotel....the staff...the convenience. Thank you for making our Spring Break so special for each of us.

Reviews.Title: “The new "it" place to be. So swanky you...”
Reviews.Author: alibee1
Reviews.Content: The new "it" place to be. So swanky you feel you should even dress up to go to sleep...especially when it's impossible to sleep with all the clubbing going on around you. Might as well look like a hip insomniac

Reviews.Title: “Guests are NOT allowed to use pool”
Reviews.Author: summertraveler2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not allow hotel guests to use the hotel pool. This is pretty bad for a Starwood brand!! Starwood unforunately, contracted promoters from Las Vegas to run its clubs which includes the rooftop "WET" similar to WET in Las Vegas. The hotel NEEDS to inform its guests prior to staying there that there is limited access to some of the hotels clubs and other areas. I am writing a letter to the CMO and President of Starwood, clearly, their time spent in business school was non existant. Whatever happened to brand loyal and integrity. The W Hollywood is taking the brand staright to hell!

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant and typical hollywood attitude”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveler100
Reviews.Content: As a gold preferred guest, I have never been so disappointed with a Starwood property in my life. I have been a starwood member for the past 8 years and have never been so misinformed and deceived until I stayed at the W in hollywood. First, I asked what rooms they had available when I came into registration. When I was told that every type of room was available, I then asked for an upgrade as a gold member, and was not given one. Okay fine, I didn't want to argue or call SPG and try to figure out why I was being denied an upgrade. It happens. This wasn't a big deal. Second, I had bottle service reservations at the hotel's restaurant, Drai's and was later told that I didn't have any. I contacted the W staff and complained about the situation, and a guy named Chris, who works for "Whatever, whenever" said he'd take care of it. I had a client coming in from across town to discuss some business over dinner and drinks. To my surprise, I was denied entrance to Drai's, or their restaurant. Chris kept giving me the run around. I was very embarrassed at this situation and couldn't believe that this so called friendly staff did not do enough to remedy the situation. Their excuse was that Drai's was a separate entity, when in fact, Drai's is on every phone speed dial in every room, advertised in each room, and highlighted on the W's website. If this is not misleading, then I do not know what is. Third, just because you are staying here doesn't mean you can dine at their restaurant or hang out at their pool or even have a drink at the bar. In fact, you are in par with the general public, which is absolutely absurd. I witnessed people who were not guests in the hotel gain entrance to the hotel's restaurant. I had to look for a restaurant outside the hotel. This is a big problem. Lastly, the staff here have a lot to learn about running a hotel and treating their customers with some respect. All I got was a bunch fake attitudes. Unless you are some millionaire or a celebrity, this isn't the place for you. They pretend to care and be nice when they really aren't.

Reviews.Title: “cool - but not competent”
Reviews.Author: JDAMWFB
Reviews.Content: If you want Hollywood Cool - this place has it. Very chic. If you want competency - not so much. Staff was very nice but one thing after another was off.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to be in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: wpier7
Reviews.Content: the W is THE official place to be in LA, period. i used to stay at the andaz - west hollywood, but wanted to be closer to the nightclubs on hollywood blvd. little did i know, all the night life entertainment i was seeking for the weekend took place right in my hotel! upon arriving, i learned that the new nightclub drai's (which is on the 12th floor of the hotel) was opening the same weekend. the entire place was like a huge party - but with exceptional service. the rooms were GREAT: plasma tv on the wall, huge walk-in shower, comfortable beds, a nice window seat with a great view of hollywood, etc. honestly, i started jumping up and down like a little kid when i walked into the room lol. if you're willing to splurge, try a suite. our neighbors next door invited us over, and their room was fabulous. back to the partying: getting into drai's seemed to be a hassle, but the lobby is a great place to hang out. i ran into terrell owens and jamie fox on the elevator - and later learned that jamie fox was staying right across from my room! fyi parking is around $35/night. and if you need sleep, try to request a room on a lower floor because you will hear music from the nightclub (we stayed on the 11th floor, but the noise wasn't an issue to me). the w is my new official hotel in LA from now on, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a complete hollywood experience.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but not really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: truthkeystone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very noisey. There is quite a party atmosphere and there is noise from the roof top and bars. You can hear noise in the hall very clearly and there is alot of people roaming late at night. We had a "spectacular" room that was pretty ordinary. No bathtub?? No turn down service?? The air conditioner was quite loud. You may not have access to the pool. It was closed at 10 Am for cleaning and was also closed during the day for a party. Pool is not available after 5. Beautiful common areas and quiet in day time.

Reviews.Title: “The most sexiest hotel experience I have had........”
Reviews.Author: normanrt
Reviews.Content: Thie W Hotel is the "sexiest" hotel I have ever stayed at. Everything was perfect from customer service all the way to their presentation. I am already in the process of planning another stay at the hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: emikelaw
Reviews.Content: This is probably the new place to be seen in LA. My favorite W is still the Hong Kong one.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby, noisy, and rude”
Reviews.Author: xanderfinch
Reviews.Content: Normally I love Starwood Hotels, and the W is beautifully designed, there's no two ways around it. However, the service at the W Hollywood is among the worst I have ever experienced. Our bed was layered with: flat sheet - dirty duvet with no cover - and another flat sheet on top of that. Nothing else. We called down to see if it could be remade properly, someone came up and dropped a stack of flat sheets at our door and scurried away. Not that we were able to sleep anyway... The noise of the club downstairs echo'ed into our room (bass drum sounds all night) well past 2am on weeknights, and we woke up at 7am to incessant hammering. When we finally called the front desk at 7:30am to complain about the noise, the front desk person audibly snickered. She actually laughed out loud at my complaint. When I asked her why she thought it was funny, she said "oh, ummm sorry, it's not funny, we can hear it too and it's really loud" -- OK, then thanks for doing something about the racket. Isn't it your job to attend to these things before people complain? Or to offer any kind of solution? She then put me on hold for 10 minutes listening to music that ensured I wouldn't be able to fall asleep even if the hammering stopped. And then, of course, the hammering never stopped, and the front desk person was unapologetic, and didn't offer earplugs OR COMPASSION. This is the kind of place where earplugs should be dropped in your hand along with the room key when you check in. We slept less than 3 hours that night due to all the noise at night and in the morning. Rude and absurd, uncourteous and unclassy. We ordered breakfast in the room and my $20 waffle had three pathetic strawberries on it and tasted & looked like a stale Eggo. We got a slab of bacon heaped on top of my husband's meal -- Thanks, DUMMIES, we're vegetarians! Final total for inedible crap: $53. Our wake up calls never came through. Our toiletries were never replenished. Our final bill was incorrect. A friend who came to pick us up was told that he wasn't allowed to pull into the stadium-sized driveway to wait TWO MINUTES for us to descend in the elevator, told that he would have to circle the block and call us to have us meet him on the street. We didn't feel we were treated kindly or with respect as guests at any point. This hotel is loud and obnoxious and snobby, and is perfect for guests who are loud and obnoxious and snobby. - - - - - Weird sidenote: don't share a room unless you're totally comfortable seeing your roommate naked. There's a full length frosted window from the shower into the suite, thus defeating any sort of potential for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “The charm of LAX two days before Christmas in the TSA wore black suits”
Reviews.Author: Skye24F
Reviews.Content: Excited about the W opening and reading good restaurant reviews, we made a reservation at Delphines. We pulled up in front of the hotel, gave the car to the valet and were greeted with a chain of velvet ropes and men in black suits who did not say "Welcome to the W," but rather "Where are you going?" We told them we were going to Delphines. We were asked if we had a reservation. We said yes. We were asked our names. We told them. We were then passed through the velvet ropes and into reception area. The restaurant was on the other side of the lobby (which is essentially a giant nightclub). To cross the lobby we met Man in Black Suit #2. He asked us where we where going, did we have a reservation, what were our names? Testly we answered again and we were passed through. On the far side of the lobby Man in Black Suit #3 allowed us to pass into the restaurant where the hostess said "How are you doing?" To which we replied, "Not so happy about all the velvet ropes." She was nice, seated us and we proceeded to have a lovely meal, fabulous food, reasonably priced, great service and we were wiling to let the bad experience pass because the food was so great. We paid our bill and then proceeded to leave the restaurant where upon we encounter Man in Black Suit #4 who said "Where are you going?" By this time we were ready to blow up. We said "TO OUR CAR" After spending over a $100 we now have to go through the indignity of three more Men in Black Suits and three more velvet ropes to leave! The manager was called. Two "managers" arrived. One listened, the other yelled directly in our faces. We both blew up. So here you have two men in their 50's, well traveled, sober, properly dressed screaming at the top of our lungs in front of reception with this evil "manager-bouncer" while peopel are checking in to $300 a night rooms. While we did not stay in a room and we cannot vouch for the rooms themselves, I can assure you we will never set foot in the place again. If you want to experience the indignity of the old Studio 54 in New York where people begged in get in to spend their money, then this is the place for you. A perfectly lovely meal was ruined by hotel staff who have no idea what real security is about. And never once was the phrase "What can we do to make this right?" uttered amid the staff shouting. Ironically this morning in the LA Times there was a review of the restaurant/club on the roof where the owner bragged about turning away 2 to 3 thousand people a night. The implication being that they were just not beautiful enough. Please.....

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: annaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: I am a Southern California local and like to go have a good night on the town once in a while and will stay in Los Angeles. I was really excited when the W opened so I decided to check it out. Liked- The hotel lobby is extremely beautiful and the bar is fun to hang out in and enjoy a cocktail before your night. The pool is definitely a seen and been seen kind of place. There are really nice cabanas to rent which will be the place to be in the summer. The valet staff and front desk staff were very pleasant. Disliked- Ok, where do I begin? The security at the hotel is some of the rudest I have ever experienced. There were 3 guests staying in the room, all registered with the front desk. However, security would not let all 3 of us up to the room. He told us that he would only allow 2 people per room to go up. We went to the front desk and they tried to talk to security but security wouldn't budge! We waited for a manager for about 10 minutes before I asked another friend of ours for his key so that we could get my guest to my room. I understand they are trying to keep non guests out of the hotel but let the guests in! It took 6 hours to bring bags to the room. I was waiting until 3:30 in the morning for the bags, not even sure if the hotel had lost them or not. We just kept getting told the bags were on their way. The Restaurant downstairs was amongst the worst food I had ever had. Almost nothing we ordered was even edible- I will say the Ahi was decent though. Even though I said the lobby bar was fun, the bartenders had HORRIBLE attitudes. A smile goes a long way The rooms are so/so. They are new and decent for the price but I wouldn't say they are up to W standards by any means. The waters on the night stand were $9 each. I don't know how they justify that. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that you can have a much better experience at without the hassle and headache.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome new hotel but VERY VERY VERY VERY LOUD club at night..”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Me2
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel is one of the newest in Hollywood and I wanted to try it out. Found a great deal via Priceline (I would not pay rack rate for this hotel) Whoa - the service from valet parking to check in - amazing!!!! The room trendy but sexy. :) The bathroom was very spacious but there is no lock on the bathroom door.(did I miss it?) Also the shower was very SEXY! two people can fit comfortably in the shower without being crowded. I don't have an issue but if you have an issue with your shadow showing in a frosted panel in the shower - this is not the hotel for you! The window seat was a neat touch! I was fun to just sit there and read a book and write a few notes. The bed was VERY big & comfortable but was kind of low. There is a dock for your iPod/iPhone so you can blast your own music. The flat panel TV was large enough as well. Cmon where is the free internet!?!? there was a fridge with a few over priced beverages, a few snack items & a large Fiji water = $9. Do yourself a favor and go to Ralph's down the street for a larger supply of those same items for less than half the cost. This hotel was totally awesome but the only downside was the BLARING MUSIC from the club or the "living room"? at 3am I do not want to hear the latest remix from the Black Eyed Peas!!! Maybe if the music were mixed a bit better I would have fallen asleep. (yes I know this is hollywood.)Then the loud stumbling drunken band that was on my floor as well. Despite the loud annoying music I would give this hotel another try.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! For a Brand New hotel, they've got it together!”
Reviews.Author: MTdawn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels; a lot of really, really nice hotels. But I just had the most incredible stay at the brand spankin' new "W Hollywood"! A lot of the hotel wasn't even up & running yet (there was only one restaurant open, "Delphine's", which is honestly AMAZING!, the Bliss spa, pool, hotel store, etc... BUT it didn't matter at all! A hotel is all about it's accommodations - which were truly wonderful & comfortable (except for the 7th Floor wrap around view suite which is unfortunately situated above a large billboard with spotlights. It might be fine for some, but I like a dark room when I sleep) while being very modern/European/sleek. It is also only as good as the people who work at it, and I have to let you (and the GM) know that the staff at here is without question the absolute best I have ever dealt with! Intelligent, knowledgeable, incredibly accommodating, fun, nice, attractive...people I want to actually have as friends - all of them! Seriously! From the room service waitstaff , "guest ambassadors" (bellhops), parking attendants, concierge, front desk, etc! Thanks to you all! I can't wait to come back when everything is open!!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel but no excuse for bad service”
Reviews.Author: bigeyed
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was beautiful very posh vibe. Stayed on the 7th floor in the Fabulous suite. Comfy and great bathroom. Ordered breakfast room service for the morning and were surprised to wake up to it already had been 2 hours late. Called room service to get help and they rushed us up an order that wasnt even ours. Called them again to ask when our food was coming. They called back 30 minutes later to tell us Sorry and 20 more minutes. This is 2.5 hours of waiting for our coffee and breakfast. We finally got fed up and ended up going to the restaurant called Delphine which was delicious and offered great service. The managers were not very eager to try to correct the service situation. All in all they seemed to be very bothered by us wanting the food that we previously ordered the night before and then gave excuses about how they are a NEW hotel and that they did not have a good groove yet. We were highly disappointed. Lastly, they did not have a pool or hot tub available yet and when we asked about the spa services the staff didnt know much about the services offered or when the pool would be ready.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing more amazing than the W Hollywood are the people who work there.”
Reviews.Author: romanrushlv
Reviews.Content: Walking in with my eyes bouncing from wall to wall and from floor to ceiling, I am only brought back to earth by the staff asking to assist me with my bag. My eyes go right back up to the ceiling and around until the front desk asked me to come forward. Now I am looking at everyone around me and thinking how cool this place is. I come back down to earth and ride up the elevator to my room, and I am in the clouds again. This room was spectacular! The complete white marble shower with the huge shower head and a peek-a-boo partially smoked glass that you can watch the 50 inch plasma screen through-Wow! They really have thought of everything this time. There was a big party going on downstairs the night I was there and I could not hear a sound. Once I got into that big white cloud of a bed, it was lights out. This place truly has the service of Southeast Asia; the style of Europe; and the edge of Hollywood. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel, Friendly staff and cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: 2BoldlyGo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on day two (the first week). The first one to stay in the room and the vibe was fantastic. It started on arrival, with 14 Valet Staff on duty (yes, I counted them) Unlike the nearby SLS, all the staff were really friendly, big smiles, warm welcomes and I was asked twice "how could we do things better?". Nice touch. Positives: 1. Located at Vine and Hollywood, two blocks or so from the main action. 2. People/Staff/Vibe was young and friendly (remembered my name multiple times) 3. The room had many features: Comfy beds, two cordless phones, charging station for Blackberry or iPhone (nice touch), Fast internet (WiFi) 4. Fantastic breakfast restaurant in the style of a French bistro downstairs 5. Amazing lobby 6. Grammy after party was held there 7. Concierge services were awesome 8. Nearby Japanese restaurant was fantastic http://www.sbe.com/katsuya/ Negatives: 1. Compared to other LA Hotels (and even the other W Hotel in Westwood) the rooms were small but well featured. (Obvious Tip: Booking a King size bed room will give you more space as it is just a room (not a suite). 2. The Spa & Pool and Fitness centre were not operating when I was there so I cannot comment on those services. 3. Prices were not cheap (Valet $35 day, Room $300 to $400, Breakfast $65 for two) 4. Bathroom was not really private - smoked glass to shower from room (beware if you like your privacy but this wasn't a problem for us). Overall I would very highly rate this hotel and strongly recommend it. Hope you enjoy!

HotelInfo.Name: W Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 6250 Hollywood Blvd, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
